page.title: 14EMERGENCY SERVICES 2
page.content: The Crieff{police station}has been in King Street since 1900. The station is part-time but there are 3 shifts which gives 24 hour cover to a wide area, including Abercairney Estate. There are 3 cars available to Crieff station to cover the rural areas. They use radio to contact base. Most calls in the Abercairney area involve accidents or poaching. They have cells to secure suspects for short periods. No part of the Estate is inaccessable to police vehicles. It would take them 10 minutes to get to the furthest point on the D block. A{999}call can come via the central station in Perth or direct to Crieff itself. It is reputed that{Bonnie Prince {Charlie's}horse was shod there on his way to the battle of{Culloden.
